title: 130+ of the Best & Easiest Karaoke Songs for Women

steps.content: Maybe it’s your first time up at the mic, or perhaps you’re not so confident about your vocals. Whatever the case, these songs are perfect for those dipping their toes in the karaoke world. They’re easy to sing and don’t require any talent! Just hop and stage and go for it! “Shake It Off” by Taylor Swift “Oops I Did It Again” by Britney Spears “Roar” by Katy Perry “Baby One More Time” by Britney Spears “Cups” by Anna Kendrick “If I Could Turn Back Time” by Cher “Ain’t No Sunshine” by Bill Withers “Born This Way” by Lady Gaga “Drivers License” by Olivia Rodrigo “Vogue” by Madonna “You Know I’m No Good” by Amy Winehouse “Wannabe” by Spice Girls “Call Me By Your Name” by Lil Nas X “Hopelessly Devoted To You” by Olivia Newton-John “Bad Guy” by Billie Eilish “Juice” by Lizzo “Levitating” by Dua Lipa “Bohemian Rhapsody” by Queen “Watermelon Sugar” by Harry Styles “A Thousand Years” by Christina Perry “Price Tag” by Jessie J “All About That Bass” by Meghan Trainor “Stay” by Rihanna “Love Song” by Sara Bareilles “Just the Way You Are” by Bruno Mars

What word best describes karaoke? Fun! So, kick off the night or party with a song everyone will love. Not only are these songs super fun to sing, but they’ll put everyone in a good mood: “Bad Romance” by Lady Gaga “Dancing Queen” by ABBA “I Kissed a Girl” by Katy Perry “Respect” by Aretha Franklin “Halo” by Beyoncé “1-2-3” by Gloria Estefan “Girlfriend” by Avril Lavigne “Blank Space” by Taylor Swift “Toxic” by Britney Spears “Teenage Dirtbag” by Wheatus “Girls Just Wanna Have Fun” by Cindy Lauper “What’s Love Got to Do With It” by Tina Turner “You’re So Vain” by Carly Simon “That Don’t Impress Me Much” by Shania Twain “It’s Raining Men” by The Weather Girls “I Wanna Dance With Somebody” by Whitney Houston “Like a Prayer” by Madonna “Firework” by Katy Perry “Addicted to Love” by Tina Turner “Shallow” by Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper “What’s Up?” by 4 Non Blondes “Livin’ on a Prayer” by Bon Jovi “Since U Been Gone” by Kelly Clarkson “Genie In a Bottle” by Christina Aguilera “Hey Ya” by Outkast “Umbrella” by Rihanna “Hollaback Girl” by Gwen Stefani

Show off your singing skills with a little country twang and boot-scootin’ beat. From lover laments to hoedown throw-downs, there’s a country karaoke song for every mood! “Jolene” by Dolly Parton “Before He Cheats” by Carrie Underwood “You’re Still The One” by Shania Twain “Crazy” by Patsy Cline “Man! I Feel Like a Woman!” by Shania Twain “Strawberry Wine” by Deana Carter “Girl Crush” by Little Big Town “Love Story” by Taylor Swift “Redneck Woman” by Gretchen Wilson “Gunpowder & Lead” by Miranda Lambert “9 to 5” by Dolly Parton “I Hope You Dance” by Lee Ann Womack “It’s a Cowboy Lovin’ Night” by Tanya Tucker “Fancy” by Reba “Cowboy Take Me Away” by The Chicks “These Boots Are Made for Walkin’” by Nancy Sinatra “Breathe” by Faith Hill “I Need You” by LeAnn Rimes “Need You Now” by Lady Antebellum “White Horse” by Taylor Swift “The Climb” by Miley Cyrus “Jesus Take the Wheel” by Carrie Underwood “Picture to Burn” by Taylor Swift “I’m A Survivor” by Reba

These classic jams are perfect for anyone who can or can’t carry a tune—because your audience will be singing along anyways! Plus, you probably already know most of them by heart, making them perfect for first-time karaokers! “Let It Go” by Idina Menzel “Stronger” by Kelly Clarkson “I Love Rock N Roll” by Joan Jett “Time After Time” by Cyndi Lauper “I Will Survive” by Gloria Gaynor “Hit Me With Your Best Shot” by Pat Benatar “Love Shack” by The B-52’s “Because of You” by Kelly Clarkson “True Colors” by Cyndi Lauper “Fallin” by Alicia Keys “Power of Love” by Celine Dion “I’m Gonna Be (500 Miles)” by The Proclaimers “Sweet Caroline” by Neil Diamond “Don’t Stop Me Now” by Queen “Stand by Me” by Ben E. King “Eye of the Tiger” by Survivor “I Want it That Way” by Backstreet Boys

Looking to impress the crowd with your vocals? If so, we’ve got the perfect list of songs for you! These hits are sure to blow the audience’s mind (as long as you can pull it off): “Someone Like You” by Adele “It’s All Coming Back To Me Know” by Celine Dion “I Have Nothing” by Whitney Houston “Love Me Harder” by Ariana Grande “Without You” by Mariah Carey “Proud Mary” by Tina Turner “Dangerous Woman” by Ariana Grande “I Will Always Love You” by Whitney Houston “Total Eclipse of the Heart” by Bonnie Tyler “Rolling in the Deep” by Adele “Don’t Rain on My Parade” by Barbra Streisand “Chandelier” by Sia “Love On Top” by Beyoncé

If you have a naturally higher singing voice, don’t be afraid to show it off! These songs are perfect for any ladies wanting to show off their whistle notes, belts, or high-vocal range—they’re sure to make the crowd go wild! “Only Girl” by Rihanna “Physical” by Olivia Newton-John “Dreamlover” by Mariah Carey “Unconditionally” by Katy Perry “What Was I Made For” by Billie Eilish “Skinny Love” by Birdy “Break Free” by Ariana Grande “My Immortal” by Evanescence “Bleeding Love” by Leona Lewis “Party In The U.S.A” by Miley Cyrus “Think of Me” from Phantom of the Opera “Popular” from Wicked “Piece by Piece” by Kelly Clarkson “Leather and Lace” by Stevie Nicks “California Gurls” by Katy Perry “Complicated” by Avril Lavigne “Fighter” by Christina Aguilera “Confident” by Demi Lovato

If you have a deeper singing voice, these songs are perfect for you! Your voice will be the talk of the town when you highlight your lower vocals—all the other girls will be totally envious! Here are some of the best songs to sing if you have a naturally deep singing voice: “I Hate Myself for Loving You” by Joan Jett “We Belong” by Pat Benatar “Hometown Glory” by Adele “Flowers” by Miley Cyrus “Greedy” by Tate McRae “Million Reasons” by Lady Gaga “Dog Days Are Over” by Florence & The Machines “Mamma Mia” by ABBA “Vampire” by Olivia Rodrigo “Royals” by Lorde “About Damn Time” by Lizzo “Ain’t No Mountain High Enough” by Tammi Terrell and Marvin Gaye “Raise Your Glass” by P!NK “I’m Coming Out” by Diana Ross “Zombie” by The Cranberries “I Put a Spell on You” by Nina Simone “Natural Woman” by Carole King “Mama Said” by The Shirelles

steps.title: Pick a shorter song.
steps.content: Pick a shorter song. When choosing a song for karaoke , ask yourself, “Will this song keep the audience’s attention?” There’s nothing worse than being stuck on stage with a song that keeps going on and on! So, opt for a tune you know you can carry all the way through. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a song for your voice.
steps.content: Choose a song for your voice. Even the best singers can sound off during karaoke if they pick a song that doesn’t match their vocal range. So, go with a tune that you don’t have to strain to sing. [2] X Research source For instance, you may not want to try belting Wicked the Musical ’s “Defying Gravity” outside of the shower unless you can hit those long high notes.

steps.title: Know your audience.
steps.content: Know your audience. Think about who you’re singing to before you get on stage. Are family members or coworkers in the audience? Are you performing in front of a group of drunk strangers? Knowing who you’re performing for can help you pick an appropriate song and sing with more confidence . [3] X Research source For example, you might not want to pick a super risque song if you’re singing at a work event. Alternatively, you may choose a breakup song if your no-good ex is in the audience.

steps.title: Pick a song you identify with.
steps.content: Pick a song you identify with. When choosing your song, pick something you have a personal connection with. What can you sing from the heart? Believe it or not, this can add strength and passion to your performance. [4] X Research source Say you’re going through a breakup. You might sing “Thank U, Next” by Ariana Grande or “I Will Survive” by Gloria Gaynor.

steps.title: Don’t be afraid to fail.
steps.content: Don’t be afraid to fail. While it may sound cliche, failure is inevitable—so embrace it! Not everyone rocks out right away, and that’s okay. If karaoke is something you love to do, keep going at it! The more you practice, the more you’ll improve and learn. [5] X Research source
